TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi Canvas extends System.Windows.Controls.Panel

Docs.summary: 領域に対する相対座標を使用して子要素を明示的に配置する領域を定義します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> contains a collection of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects, which are in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.Children%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> is the only panel element that has no inherent layout characteristics. A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> has default <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> properties of zero, unless it is the child of an element that automatically sizes its child elements. Child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> are never resized, they are just positioned at their designated coordinates. This provides flexibility for situations in which inherent sizing constraints or alignment are not needed or wanted. For cases in which you want child content to be automatically resized and aligned, it is usually best to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> element.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.ZIndex%2A> property determines the order in which child elements that share the same coordinate space appear. A higher <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.ZIndex%2A> value for one child element indicates that this element will appear above another child element that has a lower value.
If you specify them, the attached properties <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left%2A?displayProperty=fullName> take priority over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties.
Child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> are always given the full size that they desire. As a result, vertical alignment and horizontal alignment have no effect inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> is a top\-level layout control that you can use for absolute positioning of child content. For painting and drawing, you use brushes and do not have to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas>. For more information, see [Painting with Solid Colors and Gradients Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/f5b182f3-c5c7-4cbe-9f2f-65e690d08255).
By default, panel elements do not receive focus. To compel a panel element to receive focus, set the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A> property to **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** .
## 例 The following example produces three <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> elements, each element 100 pixels. The first <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> is red, and its upper\-left \(**legacyItalic tag is not supported!!!!** \) position is specified as \(0, 0\). The second <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> is green, and its upper\-left position is \(100, 100\), which is just below, and to the right of, the first square. The third <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> is blue, and its upper\-left position is \(50, 50\). Hence, the third <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> covers the lower\-right quadrant of the first <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> and the upper\-left quadrant of the second. Because the third <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> is laid out last, it appears to be on top of the other two squares—that is, the overlapping portions assume the color of the third <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle>.
[!code-csharp[CanvasOvwSample\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CanvasOvwSample/CSharp/Canvas_Ovw_Sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CanvasOvwSample\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CanvasOvwSample/VisualBasic/canvas_vb.vb#1)] [!code-xml[CanvasOvwSample\#1](~/samples/snippets/xaml/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CanvasOvwSample/XAML/default.xaml#1)]
